title: Citi CCO Rewarded for Her Contributions to Haiti's Economic Development
summary: Port-Au-Prince -- Citi announced today that Gladys Coupet, Citi's longest-serving Citi Country Officer (CCO), was recognized for her lifelong contribution to the development of the financial services sector in Haiti.
tag-1: Citi CCO Rewarded for Her Contributions to Haiti's Economic Development
tag-3: Port-Au-Prince –– Citi announced today that Gladys Coupet, Citi's longest-serving Citi Country Officer (CCO), was recognized for her lifelong contribution to the development of the financial services sector in Haiti.
tag-4: The award was presented at a ceremony led by Charles Castel, the Governor of the Bank of the Republic of Haiti (BRH), during the opening of the annual Seminar on Finance and Technology organized by Group Croissance. The seminar features panel discussions on the Haitian financial services systems, the national banking regulatory framework, the role of microfinance and innovation on mobile payment systems led by senior representatives of international organizations including the World Bank, the International Monetary Fund and the Inter-American Development Bank.
tag-5: Ms. Coupet, who was appointed CCO of Citi Haiti in 1985, is the longest-serving CCO in the firm and was also the first woman to be appointed CCO. Ms. Coupet said: "I am honored to receive this award and to have had the opportunity to put my skills and experience to work for the promotion of Haiti's economic growth. Going forward, the promotion of talent and innovation in the financial services industry will be paramount to secure economic growth across the region; the Central Bank of Haiti will continue to play a pivotal role in promoting these two goals in the country."
tag-6: Through the course of her career, Ms. Coupet has received numerous awards for outstanding achievements and professional excellence. An active member of several professional networks, Ms. Coupet presides over the Professional Bankers Association and the American Chamber of Commerce and Industry in Haiti.
tag-7: With a regional presence that spans more than 22 countries and with a history that dates back more than a century, Citi has played a significant role in the development of the Latin American region. In Haiti, the financial services firm has pledged US $2 million to support the country's reconstruction efforts after the earthquake that devastated the country in 2010.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
